description: While trying to persuade Israel to avoid an escalation, Western governments are warning Iran not to enter the fray. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Without a Hezbollah withdrawal from the border, Israeli troops may launch ground offensive
title_page: Without a Hezbollah withdrawal from the border, Israeli troops may launch ground offensive | The Straits Times
maintext:
LONDON – Israeli troops are continuing to mass at the country’s borders with Lebanon amid growing fears that the killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah will soon be followed by an Israeli ground offensive against the radical militia, which operates from Lebanese soil.
Israel has already called up two brigades of reservists – around 4,000 soldiers – and has ordered their deployment to the country’s northern border with Lebanon.
